title: 21.03 breaks dataloading with multiple CPUs
body:
## üêõ Bug Report
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
I have the following setup: 
* A dataloader that uses multiple workers 
* A model placed on a single GPU

When running the code, I believe catalyst assumes that ddp is happening and places the data on multiple GPUs even though ddp was not set to True. This is a problem starting in version 21.03 (I confirmed that in 20.12 it is not a problem).

### How To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior: run the following code sample on a machine with multiple GPUs and observe that the model is placed on all GPUs.


#### Code sample
Note that I used a dummy dataset and model to illustrate the problem.
```python
import os
import math
import torch
from catalyst import dl

os.environ["CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES"] = "2"

BATCH_SIZE = 4

class MyIterableDataset(torch.utils.data.IterableDataset):
    def __init__(self, start, end):
        super(MyIterableDataset).__init__()
        assert end > start, "this example code only works with end >= start"
        self.start = start
        self.end = end
        self.length = end-start

    def __iter__(self):
        return (x for x in [i*torch.ones(2,requires_grad=False) for i in range(self.start, self.end)])

    def __len__(self):
        return self.length

def worker_init_fn(worker_id):
    worker_info = torch.utils.data.get_worker_info()
    dataset = worker_info.dataset  # the dataset copy in this worker process
    overall_start = dataset.start
    overall_end = dataset.end
    # configure the dataset to only process the split workload
    per_worker = int(math.ceil((overall_end - overall_start) / float(worker_info.num_workers)))
    worker_id = worker_info.id
    dataset.start = overall_start + worker_id * per_worker
    dataset.end = min(dataset.start + per_worker, overall_end)        

ds = MyIterableDataset(start=3, end=100)
multi_cpu_data_loader = torch.utils.data.DataLoader(ds, batch_size=BATCH_SIZE, num_workers=4, worker_init_fn=worker_init_fn)

loaders = {"train":multi_cpu_data_loader,"valid":multi_cpu_data_loader}
dummy_model = torch.nn.Linear(2,1)

optimizer = torch.optim.Adam(dummy_model.parameters(), lr=0.001)
criterion = torch.nn.L1Loss()
target = torch.empty((BATCH_SIZE,1), dtype=torch.long).random_(5).cuda()

class CustomRunner(dl.Runner):
   
    def handle_batch(self, batch):
        output = self.model(batch)        
        loss = criterion(output,target[:output.shape[0]])       
        self.batch_metrics.update({"loss": loss.clone().detach()})

        if self.is_train_loader:
            loss.backward()            
            self.optimizer.step()
            self.optimizer.zero_grad()

runner = CustomRunner()

# model training
runner.train(
    model=dummy_model,
    optimizer=optimizer,
    loaders=loaders,
    logdir="../logs",
    num_epochs=2,
    verbose=True
)
```

### Expected behavior
The model should only use GPU 2.


### Environment
Catalyst version: 21.03
PyTorch version: 1.7.1
Torchvision version 0.8.2
TensorFlow version: N/A
TensorBoardX version: 2.1
OS: Ubuntu 16.04.6
Python version: 3.7
CUDA runtime version: 10.2
Nvidia driver version: 460.32.03
```

### Checklist
- [x ] bug description.
- [x ] steps to reproduce.
- [x ] expected behavior.
- [x ] environment.
- [x] code sample / screenshots.
- [x] I know, that I could [join Catalyst slack (#__questions channel)](https://join.slack.com/t/catalyst-team-core/shared_invite/zt-d9miirnn-z86oKDzFMKlMG4fgFdZafw) for issue discussion.
